SEARCH
Package nl.pim16aap2.animatedarchitecture.core.util.versioning

Record Class ProjectVersion

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Record
nl.pim16aap2.animatedarchitecture.core.util.versioning.ProjectVersion
Record Components:
version - The (cleaned) version of the project.

If the actual version is "1.0-SNAPSHOT", the version is "1.0".

snapshot - True if this is a snapshot version.
public record ProjectVersion(String version, boolean snapshot) extends Record
Representation of a version of the project.

To obtain the version of the project that is currently running, use IAnimatedArchitecturePlatform.getProjectVersion().

This class can be used to compare versions. For example, to check if the current version is at least version 1.0: 


 ProjectVersion currentVersion = platform.getProjectVersion();
 if (!currentVersion.isAtLeast("0.6-SNAPSHOT")) {
     // Do something
     return;
 }

For more information about the accepted version format, see parse(String).

  • Field Details

    • ERROR_VERSION

      public static final ProjectVersion ERROR_VERSION
      The version that is returned as error state. This is always equal to version "0-SNAPSHOT"; the lowest possible version.

  • Constructor Details

    • ProjectVersion

      public ProjectVersion(String version, boolean snapshot)
      Creates a new ProjectVersion.
      Parameters:
      version - The (cleaned) version of the project.

      If the actual version is "1.0-SNAPSHOT", the version is "1.0".

      snapshot - True if this is a snapshot version.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - When the version pattern does not find exactly 1 match in the input String.
      IllegalStateException - When the String that matches the pattern is not equal to the input String.

  • Method Details

    • parse

      public static ProjectVersion parse(String input)
      Parses the ProjectVersion from the input String.

      If the input String is invalid, ERROR_VERSION is returned.

      Parameters:
      input - The input string. Must be of the form "version[.sub-version[.etc]][-SNAPSHOT]", where everything between brackets is optional.

      For example, "1", "1.0", "1.0.1", "1-SNAPSHOT", "1.0-SNAPSHOT", "1.0.1-SNAPSHOT", etc.

      Returns:
      The parsed project version.

    • isNewerThan

      public boolean isNewerThan(ProjectVersion other)
      Checks if the current version is newer than the other version.

      If both the version and the snapshot are equal, the current version is not considered newer.

      If only the versions are equal, the snapshot version is considered older than the non-snapshot version.

      Parameters:
      other - The other version to compare to.
      Returns:
      True if the current version is newer than the other version.

    • isNewerThan

      public boolean isNewerThan(String other)
      Checks if the current version is newer than the other version.

      If both the version and the snapshot are equal, the current version is not considered newer and the result will be 'false'.

      If only the versions are equal, the snapshot version is considered older than the non-snapshot version.

      Parameters:
      other - The String representation of the other version to compare to.

      See parse(String).

      Returns:
      True if the current version is newer than the other version.

    • isAtLeast

      public boolean isAtLeast(ProjectVersion other)
      Checks if the current version is greater than or equal to the other version.
      Parameters:
      other - The other version to compare to.
      Returns:
      True if the current version is greater than or equal to the other version.
